utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s not what it looks like. It’s not what it looks like.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are you grinding about?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny’s brain teaser this morning. She and Koothrappali emerge from your bedroom. She is dishevelled, and Raj is dressed only in a sheet. The sole clue, it’s not what it looks like.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Just let it go, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If I could, I would, but I can’t, so I shan’t. Now, knowing Penny, the obvious answer is, they engaged in coitus. But, since that’s what it looked like, we can rule that out. Let’s put on our thinking cap, shall we? Raj is from India, a tropical country. Third World hygiene. Parasitic infections are common, such as pinworms. Mm-hmm. The procedure for diagnosing pinworms is to wait until the subject is asleep, and the worms crawl out of the rectum for air. Yes, just like that. Penny could have been inspecting Raj’s anal region for parasites. Oh, boy. That’s a true blue friend.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: They slept together, Sherlock.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, you weren’t listening. She said, it’s not what it looks like.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: She lied.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh. Well don’t I look silly sitting here wearing this?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hey. Leonard, is it awkward for you knowing that one of your dear friends had sexual intercourse with a woman you used to love in the very place you lay your head?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, I’m fine with it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That sounds like sarcasm, but I’m going to disregard it, because I have an agenda. Paintball. Specifically, the interdepartmental tournament this weekend. Now, in order to function better as a fighting unit, I thought we should establish a chain of command. Now, it goes without saying that I would outrank the three of you, but the question remains, by how much? Now, I don’t see me as some four-star general, back at HQ riding a desk and playing golf with the Secretary of Defence. But I also can’t be Sergeant Cooper, because that might lead you to think of me as just a regular Joe. This might take some thought. As you were.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What the hell is wrong with you?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, how could you do that?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What is it to you?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I got his back.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, right. You’re just jealous because it turns out I’m Penny’s number two choice after Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, if I wasn’t engaged to Bernadette, that totally could have been me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Please. Sheldon would have been before you, and he might not even have genitals.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Why do you care so much? You’re dating my sister, and Penny and I are in love.

utterance.speaker: Leonard and Howard together
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Gentlemen, if I may interject, I’ve decided my rank will be captain. If it’s good enough for Kirk, Crunch and Kangaroo, it’s good enough for me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’re not in love with Penny.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yes, I am. The god Kamadeva has shot us with his flowery arrows of love.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: He’s the Hindu version of Cupid, but way better, because he rides a giant parrot.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Raj, come on. You fall in love with any girl who smiles at you. A month ago, you were writing poems about his fiancee.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m sorry. What?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Rubbish. He’s talking rubbish.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, Bernadette, please play my clarinet.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That could have been about anyone. Besides, you have nothing to worry about, because now I’m the dusky half of Koothrapenny.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: For the record, I do have genitals. They’re functional and aesthetically pleasing.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Coming. Yup, that’s good. Wine glasses should have handles.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Keeping accurate track of your alcohol intake. Smart idea considering how trampy you get when you’ve had a few.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You heard what I did?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, I heard who you did.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, my God, I screwed up everything. I hurt Leonard, I hurt Raj, I mean, what is wrong with me? I feel like two totally different people, Dr. Jekyll and Mrs. Whore.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Don’t be so hard on yourself. Do you know the story of Catherine the Great?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: She ruled Russia in the late seventeen hundreds, and one night, when she was feeling particularly randy, she used an intricate system of pulleys to have intimate relations with a horse.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m… I’m sorry. What does this have to do with me?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: She engaged in interspecies hanky-panky, and people still call her great. I’m sure your reputation can survive you shagging a little Indian boy.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You jerk face! What did you tell Howard? Did you say there was something going on between us? Because he thinks there is. He’s completely freaking out!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Please, come in.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What the hell is wrong with you?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, you were always so nice to me, I thought maybe you liked me.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’m nice to everyone.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Damn right, you’re sorry. And you tell Howard there’s never been anything between us.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I will. Hey, Bernadette?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Do you think I have a shot with Penny?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Of course you do. You’re a cutie pie. Any girl would be lucky to have you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, I’ve done this before. In kindergarten, I was supposed to marry Jason Sorensen at recess, but by the time my class got out there, he was already engaged to Chelsea Himmelfarb. So what did I do? Hung upside down from the monkey bars, let all the boys see my underpants.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You can’t blame yourself. When your prefrontal cortex fails to make you happy, promiscuity rewards you with the needed flood of dopamine. We neurobiologists refer to this as the skank reflex.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know what? Let’s get out of here.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Where are we going?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Somewhere where no one’s seen me naked. We may have to drive awhile.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Subtlety isn’t her strong suit, is it?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Can I stay at your place for a few nights?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Really? A best friend sleepover? Yay.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, sure. Yay!

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: We’ll make popcorn, stay up all night and I’ll teach you my secret language, Op.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sounds great.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Nope. Sounds Gop Rop E A Top.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m gonna go pack a bag.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, you’re not. You’re gonna Pop A Cop Kop A Bop A Gop.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Do we really have to wear this camouflage crap to play paintball?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Who said that? Leonard, I can hear your voice, but I can’t see you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m not in the mood, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, there you are. Leonard, I know you’re upset about recent events, and I have someone here to help.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t want to talk to Amy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, it’s not Amy.

utterance.speaker: Dr Hofstadter
utterance.content: Hello, dear.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You called my mother?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, Leonard, is it really necessary to caption the obvious?

utterance.speaker: Dr Hofstadter
utterance.content: He’s been like that since he was a toddler. Look, Mommy, a butterfly. Maddening.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What’s going on? What do you want?

utterance.speaker: Dr Hofstadter
utterance.content: Sheldon informed me that you’re experiencing an emotional upheaval, and I’m here to help.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s so nice.

utterance.speaker: Dr Hofstadter
utterance.content: And we’re back to the obvious. Now, what’s up?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, uh, okay, um, I don’t want to get back together with Penny. We tried it, it was crazy, it didn’t work, but I can’t deal with the fact that she slept with my friend Raj. And then I find out that Raj’s sister Priya, who I’ve been going out with for eight months, is moving back to India. So I’m just completely confused and alone.

utterance.speaker: Dr Hofstadter
utterance.content: I understand.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Got any advice?

utterance.speaker: Dr Hofstadter
utterance.content: Yes. Buck up.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Excuse me. You’re a world-renowned expert in parenting and child development, and all you’ve got is buck up?

utterance.speaker: Dr Hofstadter
utterance.content: Sorry. Buck up, sissy pants.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thanks, Mother. I feel much better.

utterance.speaker: Dr Hofstadter
utterance.content: If you need any more help from me, my books are available on Amazon. Logging off.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Ninety-nine, one hundred. It’s like a waterfall of liquid gold. My turn.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, I don’t even know what the point of me staying in L.A. is. I haven’t gotten a single acting job since I moved out here. The closest I came was last month, I got a callback for a hemorrhoid commercial.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, I could so see you being the face of haemorrhoids.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I know, right? Maybe I should just move back to Nebraska.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, I can’t let you do that.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: For the first time ever, I have a thriving social life. And no pressure, but it kind of lives and dies with you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hi, Amy. Can I talk to Penny?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: A guest in my trundle bed and a boy at my door? I wish I could tell 13-year-old me it does get better.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: How did you know I was here?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s all over her Facebook page.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’ll take your stuff to the bedroom and clear out a drawer.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No problem. Try and keep it in your pants, okay?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, hi. What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I was wondering if you’re free Friday. They’re having a Totally ’80s Night at the Greek. Hall _ Oates, Katrina and the Waves and three-fifths of Kajagoogoo.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh. Gee, that’s really sweet, but the thing is…

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Aw, there’s a thing.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Look, honey, I was really drunk and made a huge mistake last night. We should’ve never slept together. It’s what ruins friendships.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You can’t ruin a friendship with sex. That’s like trying to ruin ice cream with chocolate sprinkles.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Come here. Just listen to me. I want to go back to the way we were before. You know, friends. No sprinkles.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh. All right.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, uh, as your friend, you might like to know that, um, we didn’t have sex in the conventional sense.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, God. Did you pull some weird Indian crap on me?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, no. After we got undressed and jumped in bed, you, you asked if I had protection.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, you did, didn’t you?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Of course. I’m always packing. Anyway, um, I had trouble putting it on and you tried to help and, that was all she wrote.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, we didn’t actually…

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I did. It was beautiful.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Penny, please, please promise me you won’t tell anybody about this.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Of course I won’t. No, I won’t.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, good. Um, can I tell people that our love burned too bright and too quickly? Kind of a Candle in the Wind deal?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Cool. Can I say it fell apart because you were all, I want to have your babies, and I was like, I’m too rock and roll to be tied down?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Can I say I ruined you for white men?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Also no.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, just the candle thing.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Cool. All right friend.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’ll see you around.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. Raj, wait. Thank you for being my friend.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Penny?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Mm-hmm?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s getting beautiful again.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, this is a Google Earth view of the field of battle.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I don’t see anything.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Give it a second to load. Whenever you’re ready, AT_T! Okay, here we go. This is us here. To the south is Professor Loomis and the Geology Department. According to their Twitter feed, they’re out of sunblock, which means they’ll have to hug the tree line or risk melanoma. That’s our edge. All we have to do is move quickly over this ridge, the rock-worshipping pasty-faced bastards won’t know what hit them. All right, let’s move out.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hang on, Sheldon. How could you not tell me your sister was moving back to India?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Maybe he was too busy writing clumsy penis metaphors about my fiancee.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Screw you. That was a beautifully written penis metaphor.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know what, guys, I’m not in the mood for paintball. What do you say we just bag it?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Fine with me.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sure, whatever.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You can’t quit. That’s a court-martial offence. That’s punishable by… You can’t quit.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sorry, Sheldon, it’s just not a good time for playing games.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This is a game to you? Uh, was the Battle of Antietam a game? Huh? Was the sack of Rome a game?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes, no and no.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wait. I just want you all to know that I forgive you. This mutiny isn’t your fault, it’s mine. I haven’t earned these bars. Although what I lack in leadership, apparently I more than make up for in sewing.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Let it go, Sheldon. I’ll get you a Jamba Juice on the way home.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. Jamba Juice is for heroes. And that’s what we’re going to be.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Following in the footsteps of Kirk, Crunch and Kangaroo. Geology isn’t a real science!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Damn those sons of bitches!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Let’s get ’em!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If there’s ever a Church of Sheldon, this will be when it started. Ow!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’d like to propose a toast to the man whose noble sacrifice inspired our victory, Captain Sheldon Cooper.

utterance.speaker: Howard and Raj
utterance.content: Here, here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excuse me. It’s Major Sheldon Cooper. With my last breath, I awarded myself a battlefield promotion. It’s kind of a big deal.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hi. You guys have a minute?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, yeah, sure.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. Um. Well, I already talked to Raj, but I wanted to apologize to the rest of you for, you know, everything.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Please, Penny, let me. We’ve decided to let our crazy, wonderful night together be just one of those memories you have and can call to mind when you’re feeling blue or you’re in the shower.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, what you doing, Quick Draw?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sorry. Go on.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Anyways, I wanted you guys all to know that I’ve been taking a really hard look at things and come to the conclusion I have to stop kidding myself. I suck at acting. It’s time for me to move back to Nebraska.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re leaving?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What are you going to do in Nebraska?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t know, maybe teach acting. Oh, sorry. Hold on. Hello?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Penny, Penny, listen, I hope you’re not doing this ’cause of you and me, because I have a girlfriend, and you’re a single woman.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Shh! It’s my agent, it’s my agent. You’re kidding. Oh, my gosh. I can’t believe it! Really? Oh, I’m so excited, thank you, thank you so much. Okay, bye. I got the haemorrhoid commercial! I start Monday.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What about Nebraska?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, hell with Nebraska. I’m gonna be a star!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (to Leonard)
utterance.content: Have you ever thought of teaching physics?

utterance.speaker: Actress
utterance.content: Ready to ride?

utterance.speaker: Penny (on screen)
utterance.content: I don’t think so, Mom. Not today.

utterance.speaker: Actress
utterance.content: Oh, sweetie. Haemorrhoids acting up again?

utterance.speaker: Penny (on screen)
utterance.content: You don’t know the half of it.

utterance.speaker: Actress
utterance.content: Oh, yes, I do. Try a dab of this.

utterance.speaker: Penny (on screen)
utterance.content: Rose-scented Preparation-H for women?

utterance.speaker: Actress
utterance.content: Now, the H is for Her.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m proud of you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Shh! Here comes my joke.

utterance.speaker: Actress
utterance.content: How are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Penny (on screen)
utterance.content: Sittin’ pretty.
